definition:
An invertible sheaf ${\mathfrak{L}}$ on a scheme $X$ is called *ample*
if for any coherent sheaf ${\mathfrak{F}}$,
${\mathfrak{F}}\otimes{\mathfrak{L}}^n$ is generated by global sections
for sufficiently large $n$.

An invertible sheaf is ample if and only if ${\mathfrak{L}}^m$ is very
ample for some $m$; this is very often taken as the definition of ample,
which can be surprising.
